"Attribute table" widget
The
Attribute Table widget
is a tool that generates a table for displaying attribute values in dynamics.
Examples of a customized widget:
The widget is used to demonstrate the dynamics of changes in
historical attributes
.
Adding a widget to the object profile is done in the
visual of instance
editing mode. When switching from the “Elements” panel to the “Widgets” tab, drag and drop (Drag&Drop) the “Attribute table” widget from the “ Lists and tables of objects” section into the workspace of the profile.
The system will display the settings to configure the widget.
Settings
To edit the widget, click on the “Settings” button. This will open a modal window, where the following parameters can be selected:
Setting
Purpose
Dynamics type
Determining the type of attribute change dynamics. The selection is using the drop-down list. Possible values:
Annually;
Every day;
Quarterly;
Monthly;
Every week;
Every second;
Every six months.
After selecting the dynamics type, the System will display additional fields for configuration.
Attribute with display dynamics type
Determining the object attribute that refers to the "Dynamics type" object type. When selecting the value of this attribute, it must be greater than or equal to the value selected as the type of widget dynamics.
Display from a new line
The data is displayed line by line relative to the dynamics type. That is, the values of each attribute period are displayed in the table from a new line. It is most often used to get rid of the horizontal scrollbar in the table. Possible periods:
Annually;
Every day;
Quarterly;
Monthly;
Every week;
Every second;
Every six months.
Type attribute to define the scale of numeric attributes
Selecting an attribute to determine the scale (digit capacity) of numeric values. It is used to configure the display of numeric attributes.
Reporting date (Attribute)
Selecting an attribute of the current object that fixes the reporting date. The selection is made using the drop-down list of attributes of the "Date" type.
Attributes
Defining version attributes that have the same time dependence as the widget dynamics type.
To adjust the color selection of the cell (s), click on the
button (reviewed below).
The parameter display is available after selecting the “ Dynamics type” parameter value.
Periods amount before the reporting date
Defining number of periods before the reporting date. The number of periods is set after selecting one of the options:
1. Attribute;
2. Constant.
If the attribute value is used, the System will display the "Attribute" field, where the corresponding attribute is selected.
When selecting the "Constant" option, a numeric value is entered in the adjacent field.
The parameter display is available after selecting the “ Dynamics type” parameter value.
The default value is "10"
.
Periods after
Enter a numeric value to determine the number of periods displayed after the reporting date.
The parameter display is available after selecting the “ Dynamics type” parameter value.
By default, the "0" value is specified to avoid displaying empty values.
Prolong values for empty periods
A feature that determines how "empty columns" are displayed in the table. Setting the parameter involves choosing one of the options:
1. attribute;
2. constant.
If the attribute value is used, the System will display the "Attribute" field, where the corresponding attribute is selected. When selecting the "Constant" option, the "Value" parameter will be displayed with the checkbox window, when the checkbox is selected, the value
true
, when the checkbox is unchecked, the value is
false
.
Prolong values anyway
A sign that determines the display of the value for future periods. Setting the parameter involves choosing one of the options:
1. attribute;
2. constant.
If the attribute value is used, the System will display the "Attribute" field, where the corresponding attribute is selected. When selecting the "Constant" option, the "Value" parameter will be displayed with the checkbox window, when the checkbox is selected, the value is
true
, when the checkbox is unchecked, the value is
false
.
Set same values by periods
Feature that determines the filling of the table for the next periods with the entered value in one cell.
The setting is
available for values with "year" period
.
If the setting is set, the specified period is hidden (the year number is not displayed). The table header will indicate the periods according to the dynamics type to display. That is, when displaying the "Monthly" period, if you enter a value for January, the data are duplicated for each month until the end of the period. Setting the parameter involves choosing one of the options:
1. attribute;
2. constant.
If the attribute value is used, the System will display the "Attribute" field, where the corresponding attribute is selected. When selecting the "Constant" option, the "Value" parameter will be displayed with the checkbox window, when the checkbox is selected, the value is
true
, when the checkbox is unchecked, the value is
false
.
The parameter display is available after selecting the “ Dynamics type” parameter value.
Number of rows
Determining the number of rows to display by entering a numeric value. The number of rows displayed determines the height of the widget. If the number of attributes is greater than the number of specified rows, then pagination by pages is displayed.
The parameter display is available after selecting the “ Dynamics type” parameter value.
Show "Total" column
Displaying a column with totals (rightmost column).
Hide column with criterion
The table is displayed
without
an attribute name column.
Put the dynamics type in a separate column
Feature that determines the display of the dynamics type value in a separate column.
The setting is available after selecting the value in the "Display from a new line" field.
After selecting this attribute value, only the
name of the day/ month/ quarter/ half-year
will be displayed; the year number will be moved to a separate column. Next, select on which side of the attribute table you want to display the column with the dynamics type (reviewed below).
Display a column with the dynamics type
Defining the attribute table side of the column location table with the dynamics type.
The setting is available after selecting the "Put the dynamics type in a separate column" option. The selection is made using the
switch , when the switch is in the "Left" position, the dynamics type column will be located on the left side of the table, when the switch is in the "Right" position, the dynamics type column will be located on the right side of the table.
Hide column with criterion
The table is displayed
without
an attribute name column.
Attributes for "Total" column
Selection of attributes for which the final value will be calculated. The final value can be calculated for attributes of the "Integer", "Numeric", "Money" type.
Attribute locking algorithms
The parameter provides the ability to specify locking for each attribute using an algorithm.
The locking algorithm is supposed to return an array of date values according to the selected dynamics type, for example, [2024-10-01, 2024-07-01, 2024-04-01].
If the returned array of dates does not match the dynamics type selected in the settings, the system will not lock anything. For example, for the quarterly dynamics type, the locking will not occur if the array [24-05-25, 24-02-27] is returned.
To add locking conditions, click on the “Add” button, then select an attribute in the opened modal window, and the condition for locking is determined using the algorithm.
All the specified locking algorithms will be displayed as a table; to delete a condition, select the row in the table and click the “Delete” button.
Block historical periods values (before the reporting date)
Feature that determines the blocking of values of historical periods. When using this parameter, it will not be possible to enter and edit cell values before the current date.
Display historical values of linked versions
Displaying values of previous versions. It is only applied to the hierarchical object type with a hierarchy attribute configured that references an object instance of the same object type.
Attributes for "Total" column
Selection of attributes for which the final value will be calculated. The final value can be calculated for attributes of the "Integer", "Numeric", "Money" type.
Freeze "Criteria" column
Fixing the first column when scrolling the entire values table.
Version date attribute
Selecting an attribute by which historical values of related versions are displayed.
By default, the "Create date" is used
To set the attributes highlighting, click on the
button, then a modal window will open, in which you need to select an attribute for highlighting from the drop-down list (the selection of several attributes is carried out sequentially).
To delete an attribute, click on the
icon, located to the right of the added attribute name.
After selecting the attribute, the System will display the fields in which you need to specify:
attribute highlighting condition, which is set using a range of values;
style. The formatting style is selected from a drop-down list of pre-prepared styles, if you need to create a new style, as well as edit or view the selected style, use the kebab menu on the right side of the field and select the desired option in the context menu.
After completing the attribute highlighting setting, click on the
button.
The layout of the generated attribute table is located under the widget parameters. This table also displays the "Order" column, which is used to customize the order in which rows are displayed in the table. To change the order of the row, click on the corresponding arrows:
Use case
Daily sales need to be visually demonstrated by displaying a table with the values of three attributes:
sales volume, USD;
sales plan fulfillment;
shift supervisor.
To do this, use the "Attribute table" widget. Note that attributes must be time-dependent for
daily
presentation, "Attribute dependence discreteness" in this case must be
daily
. Also, for the subsequent configuration of the widget, an attribute of the "Date" type will be required to fix the reporting date.
The elements "Row" and "Attribute group" are added to the object profile in the editing mode of the
visual of the instance
by dragging to the workspace. The "Attribute table" widget is placed in the grouping container. The system will display the widget parameters.
The minimum acceptable settings for the widget is a selection of parameters:
"Dynamics type"
– within the scope of the task, it is necessary to select the "Daily" value;
"Reporting date (Attribute)"
– an attribute of the "Date" type is specified;
"Attributes"
– in this field, the attributes are selected, the values of which will be displayed in the table.
The selection of attributes is possible only from attributes whose time-dependent discreteness corresponds to the type of dynamics selected in the parameter of the same name (in the current example, the "daily" value is selected).
With these parameters, the widget in the object profile on 02/19/2021 will take the following form:
You can use the following parameters to customize the table display more harmoniously:
"Number of rows"
– for example, set the value according to the number of attributes displayed in the "Criteria" column;
"Periods amount before reporting date"
– for example, the value "3", which will correspond to three days before the specified reporting date (02/19/2021);
"Periods after"
– for example, the value "3", which will correspond to three days after the specified reporting date (02/19/2021);
"Setting attribute highlighting"
– to demonstrate this parameter, the display style of the cells of the "Sales plan fulfilment" attribute with the "Yes" value will be changed.
After these edits, the table will take the following form:

the "Type attribute to define the scale of numeric attributes"
parameter is used, which specifies an object attribute referring to the registry of the "Value scale" type.
To use an additional type of dynamics selected as the
"Attribute with display dynamics type"
parameter, you will need an object attribute referring to the registry of the "Dynamics type" type.
To do this, it is necessary to supplement the attribute composition of the "Sales volume" object type:
After that, when you select the added attribute "Scale of values" in the widget settings as the parameter
"Type attribute to define the scale of numeric attributes"
you can change the scale of numeric values:
The change of scale is performed for
all
numeric values of the attributes.
When selecting the "Sales dynamics type" attribute as the
"Attribute with display dynamics type"
attribute value, you can select only the type of dynamics equal to or greater than the basic one (the basic type of dynamics is the type of dynamics set in the widget settings in the "Dynamics type" field).
If the selected dynamics type (the value of the added "Sales dynamics type" attribute) is greater than the discreteness of the attribute dependence on time, in this case it is necessary to set the type of value aggregation for each attribute in the table layout, located under the widget parameter settings. Available aggregation options:
at the beginning of the period;
at the end of the period.
When selecting the "Quarter" attribute value of the dynamics type, the table can take the following form:
If the widget is not blocked, you can change the attribute values, these edits will be saved in the historical attribute after saving the object profile. To do this, the following
parameters
may be useful (parameters do not apply to object attributes):
In this case, when entering the attribute value, this value will be set for all "empty" cells, starting from the next empty cell to the first cell with the filled value:
When using this parameter, the entered value will be assigned to all subsequent cells, including for cells with the already entered values:
When using the
"Display from a new line"
parameter, the attribute values of the previously specified period will be displayed line by line depending on the selected parameter value. For example, if you select the "Every week" value and the specified display period is three days before and after the reporting date (02/05/2021-03/03/2021), the table will take the following form:
Editing attribute values with no widget block set by the blocking algorithm is possible only for the values of the selected period (25.02.2021-03.03.2021).
When selecting the
"Show column Total"
option, fill in the
"Attributes for column Total"
, parameter, specifying attributes of the "Integer", "Numeric" or "Money" type:
After that, the sum of the values of the selected attributes for the period displayed in the table will be calculated in the separate column "Total":
When there are several values for one reporting period, you can configure several versions to be displayed simultaneously, provided that a new version is created that refers to the previous version of the current object type instance.
To do this, the "Versions" object attribute is added to the object type, referring to instances of the same type and
time-dependent
with the "Daily" discreteness. After that, in the additional object type settings on the "Hierarchy" tab, the hierarchical type is specified, and the created "Versions" attribute is set as an attribute of the hierarchy.
To create a new version of an object, a new instance is added to the "Sales volume" registry in the hierarchy of an existing object. It is recommended to use the "Registry with hierarchy" registry , for more information, see the "
Configuring the registry
".
Thus, when the
"Display historical values of linked versions"
widget parameter is active and if there are several values for one reporting period, the versions of the attribute values of the upper levels of the hierarchy will be displayed in a separate column. In this case, the attribute that characterizes the version date is selected in the
"Version date attribute"
parameter (by default, the date of creation of the object is used).
Versions are displayed in the order of appearance.
